titles.title: Human Rights Council Funding Reform Act of 2007
Human Rights Council Funding Reform Act of 2007

A bill to provide that no funds appropriated or otherwise made available by any Act for contributions for international organizations may be made available to support the United Nations Human Rights Council.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Biden with an amendment. With written report No. 110-137.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 287.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 7/25/2007--Reported to Senate amended. Human Rights Council Funding Reform Act of 2007 - States that: (1) no funds appropriated or otherwise made available by any Act for FY2008 or FY2009 for contributions to international organizations may be made available for the United Nations Human Rights Council; and (2) such prohibition shall not apply for a fiscal year if the President certifies to the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations and the House Committee on Foreign Affairs that the provision of such funds is in the U.S. national interest, or the United States is a member of the Human Rights Council.
